result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary D. Reinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (5/9/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Court does NOT order no contact with victim.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary D. Reinke in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button. Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; victim rights complied with; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to CDTP/DAA in Count 1 and DC/DAA in Count 2; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 1 and 2; State heard; Atty. Button heard (available for AODA thru VA); Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 18 mo. PO
- $363.00 CC each count
- $200 DNA surcharge each count and sample
- no violent or abusive contact with anyone
- Court does NOT order no contact with victim
- No Restitution requested
- AODA & FT and a mental health assessment
- absolute sobriety, no bars

Defendant Gary D. Reinke in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin; victim rights complied with; Atty. Button heard on motion to modify bond, remove no contact; State heard - opposes same; Court notes that without hearing from the victim, will not rule on this motion, will hold it in abayance; Court also notes that Def. would need TAD bracelett; Atty. Button to notify the Court if further hearing needed

1:19 - Defendant Gary D. Reinke in court, in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (may be eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:    Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with BJA dob 3/10/60 & her residence.  Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
